intro: Cestrum macrostemon, commonly known as the large-fruited cestrum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Cestrum macrostemon is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
